reviews.review_msg: one of the nicest and approachable prof. He is fair and very intelligent; he knows alot. Sometimes the lectures are hard to follow, but overall his teachings and marking was fair.
Totally unorganized and extremely hard to follow during lecture. I won't deny that he is incredibly passionate about what he teaches but is hard to understand.

He is very interested in what he teaches, but has a tendency of going of topic very easily. The text is not helpful and his lectures, which are not recorded, are the only source to study from. Expectations and criteria for assignments was unclear and had a significant impact on the marks.

maclean is the best professor in sfu..lectures are amazing with loads of detail....nobody knows more about islam and the subject material than he does...he speaks a lot and fast and it tough to write everything but make sure do dat.textbook is useless..a little strict marker but he usually talks about the material he tests u on...wrk hard n do wel
wonderful prof, nice person, gets carried away speaking abt the subject sumtimes but attendng his lecturs nd taking comprehensive notes is the key

After 3 years, I can safely say that he is the best prof I have ever had.  He is the most kind, understanding, and just NICE person you will ever meet.  He holds an incredible amount of information and seems to know absolutely EVERYTHING.  There is no question you can't ask that he can't give a 10 minute answer to.  TAKE HIM IF YOU CAN!  So great!
Gets way  behind in lecture. Text is useless. All you need are the notes.
Good prof, poorly delivered but interesting lectures.  Rather meaningless assignments.  But he's nice and you'll have fun.  Yay!
Approachable, friendly,and extremely knowledeable with regards to Islam and India. Must have been a Sufi Poet at one point in his life, cares about the subject matter very much.
He's great. I think he spent his youth stoned in India. Take his courses
This guy rocks!  He knows his stuff and he's interesting!

Mark Leier breathes and lives the Indian culture.  He is like a walking Indian dictionary!  Amazing prof with amazing amount of knowledge, and his lectures are pretty darn clear.  MUST attend lectures because everything is based on what he talks about! Highly recommend this professor!

Dr. Ray is a great prof. Learning about Indian history from her feels like a breath of fresh air. She is extremely passionate about the subject which makes learning much easier. The topics she covers are interesting and she makes lecture easy to follow, however, there is a good bit of reading to do, but nothing crazy. Marks a little hard imo.

Overall she is passionate about the topic of what she teaches but what she wants from tests and papers is unclear. Gives a guide of what is expected and when that is followed she states that that information is not what she was looking for. A lot of people were very unsatisfied with her marking too.

A truly inspiring and talented scholar with a great sense of humor and considerable insight into the politics of gender and identity. She demands commitment from her students but makes learning history a thoroughly rewarding experience. Always willing to help students succeed and fully grasp concepts.
